actor_awards.notes: A distinguished character actor known for his distinct scar, polished diction, and roles as sophisticated villains. He was also a passionate art collector and opened an art gallery in Los Angeles with Vincent Price.

filmography.title: Gilda
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, sinister casino owner who returns to Buenos Aires with a new wife, sparking a deadly love triangle with his right-hand man.
filmography.plot: A gambler seeking a fresh start in Argentina takes a job with a casino owner, only to discover his former lover is the boss's new wife.

filmography.title: Paths of Glory
filmography.role_description: An ambitious and callous French general who orders a suicidal attack on a German ant hill and then scapegoats his soldiers for its failure.
filmography.plot: After a failed attack on a German position, a general orders three soldiers to be tried for cowardice to cover up his own military blunder.

filmography.title: The Big Clock
filmography.role_description: The loyal and ruthless right-hand man to a publishing tycoon, who assists in covering up a murder.
filmography.plot: A magazine editor tries to solve a murder investigation in which he has been framed by his powerful boss.

filmography.title: Seven Days in May
filmography.role_description: The Secretary of the Treasury who is part of the inner circle dealing with a potential military coup.
filmography.plot: United States military leaders plot to overthrow the President because he supports a nuclear disarmament treaty and they fear a Soviet sneak attack.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Actor (Fredric March)

filmography.title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
filmography.role_description: The U.S. Secretary of State who engages in tense diplomatic negotiations with Japanese ambassadors prior to the attack on Pearl Harbor.
filmography.plot: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Visual Effects

filmography.title: The Great Race
filmography.role_description: A comedic role as a military general in this slapstick race around the world.
filmography.plot: A professional daredevil and a villainous arch-rival race from New York to Paris in the early 20th century.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: A tribune of the people who is critical of the public's celebration of Caesar's triumph.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar is a source of major concern to his close friend Brutus and a group of conspirators.

filmography.title: Vera Cruz
filmography.role_description: The puppet Emperor of Mexico who hires mercenaries to transport gold to the port of Vera Cruz.
filmography.plot: During the Mexican Rebellion of 1866, an American mercenary and an outlaw are hired to escort a countess to Vera Cruz.

filmography.title: Detective Story
filmography.role_description: A shady doctor accused of performing illegal abortions, who becomes the target of a zealous detective's wrath.
filmography.plot: A dedicated but rigid police detective's moral code is tested during a busy day at the precinct, involving a variety of criminals and a secret from his wife's past.

filmography.title: A Kiss Before Dying
filmography.role_description: The wealthy, stern father of three daughters who becomes the target of a charming but murderous social climber.
filmography.plot: A ruthless college student resorts to murder in an attempt to marry into a wealthy mining family.

filmography.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
filmography.role_description: A smooth-talking saloon owner and gang leader who is an old rival of the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A former spy for Quantrill's Raiders tries to start a new life in Arizona but gets caught between a gold shipment robbery scheme and his old associates.

filmography.title: My Name Is Julia Ross
filmography.role_description: The psychopathic son of a wealthy widow who is part of a gaslighting plot against a young woman.
filmography.plot: A young woman is hired as a live-in secretary but wakes up in a different house with a new identity, trapped in a plot to cover up a murder.

filmography.title: Alias Nick Beal
filmography.role_description: A minister who tries to save the soul of a district attorney corrupted by a mysterious stranger.
filmography.plot: An honest district attorney is tempted by a mysterious stranger named Nick Beal, who offers him political power in exchange for his integrity.

filmography.title: Coroner Creek
filmography.role_description: A ruthless and ambitious rancher who is the target of a man seeking revenge for his fiancée's death.
filmography.plot: A cowboy seeks vengeance against the man who planned the Apache raid that killed his fiancée.

filmography.title: The Doolins of Oklahoma
filmography.role_description: A persistent U.S. Marshal determined to bring down the Doolin gang.
filmography.plot: The story of the Doolin gang, focusing on Bill Doolin as he tries to leave his outlaw life behind but is pulled back in.

filmography.title: The Desert Hawk
filmography.role_description: A tyrannical prince who battles the heroic Desert Hawk for power and the princess.
filmography.plot: A desert warrior fights against a cruel prince to save his people and win the heart of a princess.

filmography.title: The Golden Horde
filmography.role_description: A mystical shaman advisor who plays a key role in the conflict involving Genghis Khan.
filmography.plot: English knights arrive in Samarkand to help defend the city against the invading forces of Genghis Khan.

filmography.title: The Human Duplicators
filmography.role_description: A scientist who is replaced by an android duplicate as part of an alien invasion plot.
filmography.plot: An alien is sent to Earth to create android duplicates of humans to infiltrate the government and take over the planet.

filmography.title: The Alligator People
filmography.role_description: A scientist whose experiments with reptile hormones go horribly wrong, transforming humans into alligator-like creatures.
filmography.plot: A woman searches for her missing husband and discovers he is at a remote plantation where a scientist is conducting bizarre experiments.

filmography.title: The Green Glove
filmography.role_description: An unscrupulous art dealer pursuing a valuable religious relic.
filmography.plot: An American paratrooper returns to France to recover a jeweled gauntlet he found during the war, pursued by a criminal art collector.

filmography.title: The Fighting Guardsman
filmography.role_description: A French aristocrat villain in this swashbuckling adventure.
filmography.plot: A French baron leads a double life as a bandit leader, robbing from the rich to give to the poor and fighting against the King's tyranny.

filmography.title: The Black Arrow
filmography.role_description: The treacherous guardian of the protagonist who murdered his father.
filmography.plot: A young knight returns from the War of the Roses to discover his father has been murdered and joins a band of outlaws to seek justice.

filmography.title: Dead Ringer
filmography.role_description: A lawyer and friend involved in the twisting plot of twin sisters.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman is murdered by her poor twin sister, who then takes over her identity.

filmography.title: Counter-Attack
filmography.role_description: A Soviet officer who orders a mission to capture a German soldier for information.
filmography.plot: Russian paratroopers and partisans trap a group of German soldiers in a cellar and try to trick them into revealing their plans.

filmography.title: Knock on Any Door
filmography.role_description: The aggressive prosecutor determined to convict a young hoodlum of murder.
filmography.plot: A lawyer defends a young man from the slums accused of killing a police officer, arguing that society is partly to blame.
